page.title: 15Churchgate Street - Memories
page.content:
{Joe's}hobbies were rabbiting. They used to go out to the fields and catch the rabbits. They enjoyed it.
When{Wally}was younger the rent of his house was half a crown which, in our day is 13p. This is the cost of a packet of crisps.
{Grace Allen}remembers her first cinema film. It was Mickey Mouse and she saw it in Portsmouth.
{Wally}goes to the Darby and Joan Club. He has meals on wheels four days a week and his daughter visits him on Sundays.
{Percy} has seen a lot of changes in Harlow from gas lamps to electricity. He remembers Churchgate Street before it was tarmac.
